intro: Psychotria verschuerenii var. reducta, commonly known as the red-veined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white flowers that are often followed by dark blue berries. This species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ornamental value and potential ecological significance.
